item.title: Php Wrappers
item.description: PHP Wrappers and Remote Code Execution (RCE) In the context of Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerabilities, PHP wrappers play a crucial role in how external resources or data are handled by PHP scripts. Wrappers essentially allow PHP to access various data sources, including files, URLs, and even remote systems. When misconfigured, PHP wrappers can facilitate an attacker’s ability to execute arbitrary commands, leading to potential RCE vulnerabilities. Below, I’ll cover some important PHP wrappers and how they can be exploited, with a specific focus on the role of allow_url_include, input, and data wrappers.

item.title: Annie Ctf
item.description: This lab was relativey simple but taught me a lot of things Enumeration The thing I like to do is find all the open ports with rustscan and then run nmap for futher analysis, it makes my thing faster by about 10 minutes. So I ran these following commands rustscan -a $ip -b 65535 -u 5000 | tee rustscan Then I run nmap on the found ports sudo nmap $ip -p xxx,xxx -sV -sC I saw that two ports were open, One was ssh on 22 and real server on 7070
